abstract: Some 1,300 children reside in refugee camp known as the Jungle outside Calais, France, with many having arrived alone after harrowing journeys; uncertainty over what to do with children, who speak no French and little English, has slowed government's plans to demolish camp.

headline.print_headline: Young and Alone in France’s Migrant ‘Jungle’
headline.main: ‘I Am Alone’: Migrant Children in Calais ‘Jungle’ Face an Uncertain Fate

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The fate of the young migrants has become a major sticking point in the French government’s plans to demolish the camp, which could happen within days....
lead_paragraph: The fate of the young migrants has become a major sticking point in the French government’s plans to demolish the camp, which could happen within days.
